description: Former President Joe Biden returned to the national spotlight to assail his successor for endangering the Social Security payments relied on by millions of Americans.
title: Biden Breaks Silence to Jab Trump for Imperiling Social Security

description: President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva is likely to grant political asylum to a recently convicted former first lady of Peru, who’s been sentenced on money laundering charges, according two people with knowledge of the matter.
title: Brazil to Lean Toward Granting Asylum to Peru’s Convicted Former First Lady

description: President Donald Trump signed a directive Tuesday aimed at bolstering the use of technology in the permitting process for infrastructure developments, part of a broader administration effort to cut red tape and speed the approval of new projects.
title: Trump Seeks to Boost Use of Technology to Speed Up Permitting

description: President Donald Trump has signed orders overhauling where and how the federal government spends taxpayer money, encouraging agencies to move out of downtown districts and requiring agencies to buy more off-the-shelf products.
title: Trump Signs Executive Orders on Federal Purchasing, Office Space

description: The White House announced Tuesday that it was eliminating the traditional press pool access for wire services after a federal court ordered the administration to end viewpoint discrimination against the Associated Press.
title: White House Moves to Limit Newswire Access After AP Lawsuit Win

description: The first of two official leaders’ debates before Canada’s April 28 federal election has been rescheduled so voters don’t skip it in favor of a hockey game.
title: Canada Rearranges Election Debate So People Can Watch Hockey

description: President Donald Trump launched a probe into the need for tariffs on critical minerals, the latest action in an expanding trade war that has targeted key sectors of the global economy.
title: Trump Launches Critical Minerals Probe to Weigh New Tariffs

description: President Donald Trump wants Congress to change a policy that gives certain drugs longer protection from drug price negotiations in Medicare, a fix that could address one of the drug industry’s top complaints with the Biden-era law.
title: Trump Signs Order Aimed at Lowering Prescription Drug Prices

description: El Salvador has been admitted into a Customs and Border Protection program that allows its citizens to apply for swifter entry when traveling to the US — a day after President Donald Trump welcomed the Central American nation’s leader to the White House.
title: El Salvador Gets Travel Program Perk a Day After Leader Visits Trump

description: A US judge admonished a Trump administration lawyer for failing to say how the government is facilitating the return of a Maryland man wrongly deported to a prison in El Salvador, a day after Salvadoran President Nayib Bukele said he’s not sending him back.
title: Judge Says US Has Done ‘Nothing’ to Return Wrongly Deported Man

description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, congressional correspondent Erik Wasson looks at the potential impact of cuts at the IRS. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Tax Deadline Day Comes With IRS Enforcement Shrinking

description: The State Department dismissed as premature reports that the Trump administration is seeking to slash the agency’s budget almost in half, including by eliminating US funding for the North Atlantic Treaty Organization and the United Nations.
title: State Department Calls Reports on Cost-Slashing Plan Premature

description: The US lifted sanctions it had imposed over alleged corruption on a senior minister in Hungarian Prime Minister Viktor Orban’s government, underscoring the stark shift in bilateral ties under President Donald Trump.
title: US Lifts Sanctions on Hungary Minister in Trump’s Gift to Orban

description: Spanish Economy Minister Carlos Cuerpo said Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent indicated that he wants a US-European Union deal on tariffs.
title: Spain’s Cuerpo Says Bessent Signaled He Wants EU Deal on Tariffs

description: The Bank of Canada is likely to hold interest rates steady on Wednesday as officials take stock of the damage posed by US President Donald Trump’s trade war.
title: Bank of Canada Likely to Pause to Assess Tariff Hit: Decision Guide

description: Harvard University is tapping a white-hot lawyer with conservative bona fides to fight the Trump administration’s threat to withhold billions in funding, betting his ties to the president and experience guiding billionaires through legal thickets can win the school a reprieve.
title: Meet the Conservative Lawyer Helping Harvard Take On Trump

description: President Donald Trump will sign a memorandum aimed at curbing fraud in Social Security programs on Tuesday, a push that has been a key focus for Elon Musk’s Department of Government Efficiency effort.
title: Trump Memo Will Boost Musk’s Bid to Find Social Security Fraud

description: President Donald Trump called on China to reach out to him in order to kick off negotiations aimed at resolving the escalating trade fight between the world’s two largest economies.
title: Trump Presses China to Make Tariff Offer to Calm Trade War

description: A member of Elon Musk’s government efficiency team asked Securities and Exchange Commission Acting Chairman Mark Uyeda to grant read and write access to some agency data, according to people familiar with the matter.
title: SEC Pushes Back on DOGE Request for Access to Some Agency Data

description: Former Peruvian President Ollanta Humala was sentenced to 15 years in prison for money laundering Tuesday, a key victory for anti-graft prosecutors.
title: Peru Sentences Ex-President Humala to 15 Years for Money Laundering

description: France said it will recall its ambassador to Algeria for consultations, following the expulsion of French consular and diplomatic staff from the North African country amid an escalating dispute over indictments related to terrorism.
title: France-Algeria Spat Escalates With Diplomatic Staff Expelled

description: South Africa’s new envoy to the US glossed over remarks he made in the past about President Donald Trump and said relations between Pretoria and Washington are vital to the national interest.
title: South Africa’s New US Envoy Plays Down Past Criticism of Trump

description: Republicans in the White House, Senate and House are drafting analyses on how best to craft a new tax bracket for the wealthiest Americans, work that signals the GOP under President Donald Trump is seriously considering ideas to raise taxes on the rich.
title: Millionaire Tax-Hike Talks Gain Steam as Trump Signals Openness

description: Bulgaria’s ruling coalition lost its majority in parliament after a founding party left, signaling that the country’s years-long political crisis is set to flare up again.
title: Bulgarian Ruling Coalition Loses Majority as One Party Leaves

description: Romanian’s ruling coalition could beat back a far-right surge in May’s presidential election as its candidate gains momentum, a poll showed.
title: Romania’s Mainstream Gains Against Far-Right in Vote, Poll Shows

description: Representative Marjorie Taylor Greene sold US Treasuries and bought stakes in Amazon.com Inc., Blackstone Inc. and Tesla Inc. the day before President Donald Trump put a 90-day pause on retaliatory tariffs and prompted a market rally.
title: Trump Ally Marjorie Taylor Greene Bought Tesla, Amazon, Blackstone Before Rally

description: Chile’s leading presidential candidate is embarking on a review of a landmark deal signed last year between lithium supplier SQM and state-owned Codelco.
title: SQM-Codelco in Crosshairs of Chile Presidential Frontrunner

description: Jordan said it arrested 16 people for involvement in an alleged plot to “undermine national security” in an operation that also uncovered weapons factories inside the kingdom.
title: Jordan Arrests 16 People Over Plot to Hurt National Security

description: The first session of Kosovo’s newly elected parliament collapsed Tuesday, delaying the formation of a new government and risking a snap election.
title: Kosovo Hits Political Deadlock as Parliament Session Collapses

description: Iran has faced suspicion for decades over its nuclear ambitions and whether it’s developing the capability to fire an atomic weapon.
title: How Close Is Iran to a Nuclear Weapon as Trump Eyes a Deal?

description: The European Union and US made scant progress bridging trade differences this week as officials from President Donald Trump’s administration indicated that the bulk of the US tariffs imposed on the bloc will not be removed.
title: EU Expects US Tariffs to Stay as Talks Make Little Progress

description: Americans are increasingly looking for jobs in Britain amid President Donald Trump’s funding cuts and a darkening economic outlook.
title: More Americans Are Eyeing Jobs in UK Amid Trump Funding Cuts

description: President Donald Trump escalated his administration’s fight with Harvard University by threatening its tax-exempt status after the school defied the government’s demands to change its policies in exchange for billions of dollars of federal funding.
title: Trump Threatens Harvard’s Tax-Exempt Status After School’s Rebuke

description: White House science and technology director Michael Kratsios said the US will need to make “smart choices” with public research funding to stay competitive in areas like artificial intelligence as the Trump administration’s sweeping budget cuts spread to research organizations.
title: Trump Tech Aide Calls for ‘Creative’ R&D Push After Budget Cuts

description: Federal workers who scoffed when they first received Elon Musk’s infamous “Fork in the Road” buyout initiative are taking different tack now that there is a second offer on the table: saying yes.
title: Federal Workers Jump at Buyout Offers They Once Shunned

description: Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney said his government will allow automakers to import US-manufactured cars and trucks without tariffs, as long as the companies keep making vehicles in Canada.
title: Canada Scraps Tariffs for Automakers That Keep Plants Going

description: The value of Ireland’s exports to the US jumped by more than 200% in February from a year earlier, driven by medical and pharmaceutical products, according to the country’s statistics office.
title: Irish Pharma Exports to US Surge Amid Tariff Threat

description: Billionaire hedge fund manager Bill Ackman has donated $250,000 to a super PAC supporting former New York Governor Andrew Cuomo in New York City’s mayoral race.
title: Ackman Gives $250,000 to Cuomo’s New York City Mayoral Run

description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu sparred with Emmanuel Macron over the French president’s plan to recognize a Palestinian state and encourage other countries to do the same.
title: Netanyahu, Macron Spar Over Recognition of Palestinian State

description: A coalition deal between Germany’s center-left Social Democrats and Chancellor-in-waiting Friedrich Merz’s conservatives has yet to be signed, but rifts between the parties are already appearing.
title: Merz’s Ukraine Missile Plan Exposes Rifts in Germany’s Coalition

description: The US has told Group of Seven allies it won’t endorse a statement condemning Russia’s deadliest attack on Ukraine this year because it wants to keep negotiations with Moscow on track.
title: US Derails G-7 Condemnation of Russian Missile Strike on Ukraine

description: Container ships, the workhorses of global trade transporting almost 90% of the world’s manufactured goods, have become a target in Donald Trump’s conflict with China — and none of the major carriers stand to escape the extra costs.
title: Trump’s China Ship Fees Set to Hit Global Shipping Giants

description: The European Union is exploring ways to extend its sanctions against Russia without needing the support of all 27 member states.
title: EU Plans Workaround to Sideline Hungary in Russia Sanctions

description: The top US envoy to Budapest warned Hungary to be vigilant about attracting Chinese investments, highlighting a potential source of tension in the otherwise warm ties between Prime Minister Viktor Orban and President Donald Trump.
title: US Envoy Tells Orban’s Hungary to Be Wary of Chinese Investments

description: Chinese President Xi Jinping arrived in Malaysia late Tuesday, state media CCTV reported, marking his second stop in Southeast Asia as he pushes to strengthen ties in the region amid tariff tensions with the US.
title: Xi Arrives in Malaysia to Discuss Bilateral Cooperation

description: The US will focus on restricting Iran’s missile capability and uranium enrichment rather than dismantling its entire nuclear program, according to Donald Trump’s top Middle East envoy, Steve Witkoff.
title: US Wants Iran to Limit Nuclear Program Rather Than Scrap It

description: A group of embattled government advisers will meet this week in the first major test of who controls US vaccine policy: scientific experts or Robert F. Kennedy Jr.
title: RFK Jr.’s Vaccine Panel Meets in Early Test for Scientific Sway

description: The conclusion of the tax filing season Tuesday is about to provide early clues toward resolving a nagging question hanging over the US Treasury: How honest will Americans be about their income when there are suddenly fewer auditors to check them?
title: Tax Day Arrives With the Implications of a Trump-Era IRS Still Taking Shape

description: The US economy is set to lose billions of dollars in revenue in 2025 from a pullback in foreign tourism and boycotts of American products, adding to a growing list of headwinds keeping recession risk elevated.
title: US Economy to Lose Billions as Foreign Tourists Stay Away

description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.
title: Orban Snagged by Soulmate Trump’s Trade Storm

description: Japan will seek early results from its US tariff negotiations set to start in a day or so, according to top trade representative Ryosei Akazawa.
title: Japan Tariff Team Aims for Early Results From US Negotiations

description: Kenya plans to seek private investment to develop and operate two seaports on the Indian Ocean as it battles rising competition from harbors in neighboring countries.
title: Kenya Seeks Private Funding for Ports as Competition Intensifies

description: Attacks in Sudan’s Darfur region probably killed more than 400 civilians this week, the United Nations said, as the UK hosts an international conference aimed at easing access to aid and finding a path to end the two-year civil war.
title: Sudan Fighting Kills Hundreds as UK Forum Discusses Relief

description: China has ordered its airlines not to take any further deliveries of Boeing Co. jets as part of the tit-for-tat trade war that’s seen US President Donald Trump levy tariffs of as high as 145% on Chinese goods, according to people familiar with the matter.
title: China Orders Boeing Jet Delivery Halt as Trade War Expands

description: Chinese President Xi Jinping urged Vietnam to jointly oppose “unilateral bullying” in his first overseas trip this year in a veiled jab at the US. Hanoi’s initial silence on the request shows its attempt to walk a tightrope between the two powers.
title: Xi’s Visit Shows Vietnam’s Balancing Act as Tariffs Loom

description: Singapore’s government called for a May 3 election as Prime Minister Lawrence Wong seeks a mandate to tackle cost-of-living concerns and lead a nation that has long benefitted from global trade into a complicated new era.
title: Singapore Calls May Election as Prices, Trade War Take Toll

description: China’s top official on Hong Kong affairs has lashed out at President Donald Trump, saying his tariff war is less about money and more about attacking the well-being of Chinese people.
title: China Official Calls US ‘Enemy’ Targeting Hong Kong’s Survival

description: After weeks of saying he’s willing to work with the Trump administration to combat antisemitism, Harvard University President Alan Garber emerged Monday as the highest-profile challenger to the government’s effort to force change at elite US colleges.
title: Harvard’s Vow to Resist Trump Sets Up $9 Billion Funding Fight

description: President Donald Trump’s special envoy described his talks with Russian leader Vladimir Putin last week as “compelling,” saying they discussed steps that could end the war in Ukraine and perhaps lead to business opportunities.
title: Trump Envoy Witkoff Describes a ‘Compelling’ Meeting With Putin

description: Former Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen said the rationale for President Donald Trump’s tariff policies was “unclear and not at all sensible,” adding she believes China would like to “de-escalate this conflict.”
title: Yellen Says Trump Tariff Policy Misguided, Warns of Uncertainty

description: Japan is set for talks with the US this week that will test whether President Donald Trump is ready to strike trade deals — and whether being a close ally will carry any weight at the negotiating table.
title: Japan Provides Litmus Test for Trump’s Deal Appetite With Allies

description: Compal Electronics Inc., Wistron Corp. affiliate Wiwynn Corp. and US company Jabil Inc. are set to submit revised offers for Advanced Micro Devices Inc.’s AI server assembly plants, according to people familiar with the matter.
title: Taiwan Bidders Are Said to Be Circling AMD’s ZT Server Assets

description: South Korea unveiled a 12 trillion won ($8.4 billion) supplementary budget plan to shore up the country’s export-reliant economy threatened by Donald Trump’s tariffs as officials prepare to head to the US to negotiate a lower duty.
title: South Korea Unveils Stimulus Plan as Tariff Team Readies US Trip

description: Some major public institutions in Canada, including a pension management firm and a leading hospital, are advising staff against traveling to the US, marking a greater erosion in the country’s longstanding trust with its neighbor.
title: Avoid US or Take Burner Devices, Canadian Executives Tell Staff

description: The volume of goods processed by Chinese ports slowed last week for the first time since the Lunar New Year holiday — a trend that will undercut the value of exports going forward if it continues.
title: China’s Sea Cargo Flow Starts to Slow After Tariffs Take Effect
